intro: Baissea concinna, commonly known as the slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes. It is often found in association with other wetland flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat. Baissea concinna plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
